listitem.para:
Outputs a list that describes the characteristics of the machine. The list has the following format:
[IsWindows Wordsize BitmapWidth BitmapHeight IsPaletteEnable WindowsVersionMajor WindowsVersionMinor WorkingAreaWidth WorkingAreaHeight DesktopWidth DesktopHeight WindowWidth WindowHeight]
Where the meaning of each member is given by the table below.
Member Meaning
IsWindows 1, if this is Microsoft Windows. 0, otherwise.
Wordsize
The number of bits in a machine word. If the version of &PRODUCTNAME; was compiled for a 32-bit machine, this will be 32 even when running on a 64-bit Windows.
BitmapWidth The width of the drawable area on the &PRODUCTNAME; Screen, in pixels.
BitmapHeight The height of the drawable area on the &PRODUCTNAME; Screen, in pixels.
IsPaletteEnabled 1, if a palette is enabled, 0, otherwise.
WindowsVersionMajor The major version of Windows.
WindowsVersionMinor The minor version of Windows.
WorkingAreaWidth The width of the part of the desktop that is not obscured by the taskbar, in pixels.
WorkingAreaHeight The height of the part of the desktop that is not obscured by the taskbar, in pixels.
DesktopWidth The width of the whole desktop, in pixels.
DesktopHeight The height of the whole desktop, in pixels.
WindowWidth
The width of the &PRODUCTNAME; screen window, in pixels. This includes the window frame, the vertical scollbar, etc.
WindowHeight
The height of the &PRODUCTNAME; screen window, in pixels. This includes the window frame, the title bar, the menu bar, the horizontal scrollbar, etc. If the commander window is docked, this also includes the thickness of the splitter and the commander.
